newsitem.title: JAPAN: Thailand's Amnuay confident in future as fin min.
newsitem.headline: Thailand's Amnuay confident in future as fin min.

text.p: Thailand's Finance Minister Amnuay Viravan said on Wednesday he was confident in his future as the country's finance minister.

Speaking to Reuters at a hotel in Tokyo, he added that he has no doubt about the success of Thailand's intervention in the foreign exchange market and that Thailand has a definite policy to maintain the stability of the baht.
"There's no question" about his future as finance minister, he said.

Concerns over the health of the Thai economy, a slump in the stock market and speculation over a possible change in the Thai finance portfolio combined to batter the baht, driving it to 26.250/26.300 to the dollar on Wednesday morning, dealers said.
Central bank intervention, however, helped the currency recover to 26.030/26.080 later in the day, they added.
